sentence: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
translation: 快速的棕色狐狸跳过懒惰的狗。
grammar: 这句话使用的是一般现在时，描述的是一个经常发生的动作。
related_sentences: The fast brown fox leaps over the lazy dog.
A quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog.
The agile brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

sentence: She sells seashells by the seashore.
grammar: 这句话使用的是一般现在时，描述的是一个经常发生的动作。
related_sentences: She sells seashells near the sea.
She sells seashells at the beach.
She sells seashells along the coast.

sentence: The cat, which had been sitting on the mat all day, suddenly jumped up when it heard a noise outside the window.
translation: 那只整天坐在垫子上的猫，听到窗外的声音时突然跳了起来。
grammar: 这句话使用了过去完成进行时和过去时，描述了一个过去的动作和一个过去的状态。
related_sentences: The dog, which had been lying on the mat, barked loudly when it saw a stranger.
The bird, which had been perched on the branch, flew away when the cat approached.
The child, who had been playing in the yard, ran inside when it started to rain.

sentence: If I had known you were coming, I would have baked a cake, but now it's too late.
translation: 如果我知道你要来，我会烤一个蛋糕，但现在已经太晚了。
grammar: 这句话使用了虚拟语气，描述了一个与过去事实相反的假设。
related_sentences: If she had studied harder, she would have passed the exam, but she didn't.
If they had left earlier, they would have caught the train, but they were late.
If we had saved more money, we could have bought a bigger house, but we didn't.

sentence: The book that you lent me last week was so interesting that I couldn't put it down until I finished it.
translation: 你上周借给我的那本书太有趣了，我一口气读完了。
grammar: 这句话使用了定语从句和结果状语从句，描述了一个过去的动作和结果。
related_sentences: The movie that we watched last night was so boring that I fell asleep.
The meal that he cooked for us was so delicious that we ate it all.
The story that she told me was so funny that I couldn't stop laughing.

sentence: Despite the fact that it was raining heavily, they decided to go for a hike in the mountains.
translation: 尽管下着大雨，他们还是决定去山里徒步。
grammar: 这句话使用了让步状语从句，描述了一个与预期相反的动作。
related_sentences: Despite the fact that it was snowing, they went skiing.
Despite the fact that it was late, they continued working.
Despite the fact that it was hot, they went for a run.

sentence: He must have been very tired, for he fell asleep as soon as he lay down on the bed.
translation: 他一定是非常累了，因为他一躺在床上就睡着了。
grammar: 这句话使用了情态动词和原因状语从句，描述了一个推测和结果。
related_sentences: She must have been hungry, for she ate everything on her plate.
They must have been lost, for they asked for directions.
He must have been cold, for he put on a jacket.

sentence: What a beautiful day it is! I wish we could spend it at the beach instead of being stuck in the office.
translation: 多么美好的一天啊！我希望我们能在海滩上度过，而不是困在办公室里。
grammar: 这句话使用了感叹句和虚拟语气，表达了一个愿望和现实的对比。
related_sentences: What a wonderful surprise it was! I wish you could have been there.
What an amazing view it is! I wish we could stay here longer.
What a delicious meal it was! I wish I could eat it again.

sentence: The project, which had been delayed several times due to unforeseen circumstances, was finally completed last week.
translation: 由于不可预见的情况，该项目被多次推迟，终于在上周完成了。
grammar: 这句话使用了定语从句和过去完成时，描述了一个过去的动作和结果。
related_sentences: The event, which had been planned for months, was a huge success.
The building, which had been under construction for years, was finally opened.
The book, which had been written over a decade, was published last year.

sentence: By the time we arrived at the station, the train had already left, so we had to wait for the next one.
translation: 当我们到达车站时，火车已经离开了，所以我们不得不等下一班。
grammar: 这句话使用了过去完成时和过去时，描述了一个过去的动作和结果。
related_sentences: By the time she got home, the guests had already left, so she missed the party.
By the time he finished his work, the office had already closed, so he had to leave.
By the time they reached the airport, the plane had already taken off, so they missed their flight.
